definitions.definition: under or below something else, especially when it is hidden or covered by the thing on top

examples.text: The coin rolled underneath the piano.
This jacket's too big, even with a sweater underneath.

definitions.definition: used to talk about somebody’s real feelings or character, as opposed to the way they seem to be

examples.text: Underneath her cool exterior she was really very frightened.
He seems bad-tempered, but he's very soft-hearted underneath.

wordOrigin: Old English underneothan; compare with beneath.
